documentation.text:
@title The ConfirmedOwner contract
 @notice A contract with helpers for basic contract ownership.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

userdoc.notice: A contract with helpers for basic contract ownership.

documentation.text:
@title The ConfirmedOwner contract
 @notice A contract with helpers for basic contract ownership.

@notice Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address,
 pending.
@notice Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.
@notice Get the current owner
@notice validate, transfer ownership, and emit relevant events
@notice validate access
@notice Reverts if called by anyone other than the contract owner.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

userdoc.notice: A contract with helpers for basic contract ownership.

documentation.text:
@dev Contract module which allows children to implement an emergency stop
 mechanism that can be triggered by an authorized account.
 This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the
 modifiers `whenNotPaused` and `whenPaused`, which can be applied to
 the functions of your contract. Note that they will not be pausable by
 simply including this module, only once the modifiers are put in place.
@dev Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.
@dev Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.
@dev Initializes the contract in unpaused state.
@dev Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

constructor.details: Initializes the contract in unpaused state.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

devdoc.details: Contract module which allows children to implement an emergency stop mechanism that can be triggered by an authorized account. This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifiers `whenNotPaused` and `whenPaused`, which can be applied to the functions of your contract. Note that they will not be pausable by simply including this module, only once the modifiers are put in place.

documentation.text:
@dev Provides information about the current execution context, including the
 sender of the transaction and its data. While these are generally available
 via msg.sender and msg.data, they should not be accessed in such a direct
 manner, since when dealing with meta-transactions the account sending and
 paying for execution may not be the actual sender (as far as an application
 is concerned).
 This contract is only required for intermediate, library-like contracts.

devdoc.details: Provides information about the current execution context, including the sender of the transaction and its data. While these are generally available via msg.sender and msg.data, they should not be accessed in such a direct manner, since when dealing with meta-transactions the account sending and paying for execution may not be the actual sender (as far as an application is concerned). This contract is only required for intermediate, library-like contracts.

documentation.text:
@dev These functions deal with verification of Merkle Trees proofs.
 The proofs can be generated using the JavaScript library
 https://github.com/miguelmota/merkletreejs[merkletreejs].
 Note: the hashing algorithm should be keccak256 and pair sorting should be enabled.
 See `test/utils/cryptography/MerkleProof.test.js` for some examples.
 WARNING: You should avoid using leaf values that are 64 bytes long prior to
 hashing, or use a hash function other than keccak256 for hashing leaves.
 This is because the concatenation of a sorted pair of internal nodes in
 the merkle tree could be reinterpreted as a leaf value.

@dev Returns true if a `leaf` can be proved to be a part of a Merkle tree
 defined by `root`. For this, a `proof` must be provided, containing
 sibling hashes on the branch from the leaf to the root of the tree. Each
 pair of leaves and each pair of pre-images are assumed to be sorted.

@dev Returns the rebuilt hash obtained by traversing a Merkle tree up
 from `leaf` using `proof`. A `proof` is valid if and only if the rebuilt
 hash matches the root of the tree. When processing the proof, the pairs
 of leafs & pre-images are assumed to be sorted.
 _Available since v4.4._

devdoc.details: These functions deal with verification of Merkle Trees proofs. The proofs can be generated using the JavaScript library https://github.com/miguelmota/merkletreejs[merkletreejs]. Note: the hashing algorithm should be keccak256 and pair sorting should be enabled. See `test/utils/cryptography/MerkleProof.test.js` for some examples. WARNING: You should avoid using leaf values that are 64 bytes long prior to hashing, or use a hash function other than keccak256 for hashing leaves. This is because the concatenation of a sorted pair of internal nodes in the merkle tree could be reinterpreted as a leaf value.

@dev Interface of the ERC165 standard, as defined in the
 https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165[EIP].
 Implementers can declare support of contract interfaces, which can then be
 queried by others ({ERC165Checker}).
 For an implementation, see {ERC165}.

@dev Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by
 `interfaceId`. See the corresponding
 https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section]
 to learn more about how these ids are created.
 This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

devdoc.details: Interface of the ERC165 standard, as defined in the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165[EIP]. Implementers can declare support of contract interfaces, which can then be queried by others ({ERC165Checker}). For an implementation, see {ERC165}.

@notice emitted when an on feed operator gets slashed.
 Node operators are not slashed more than the amount of rewards they
 have earned.  This means that a node operator that has not
 accumulated at least two weeks of rewards will be slashed
 less than an operator that has accumulated at least
 two weeks of rewards.
@notice This error is thrown when the updated reward duration is less than a month
@return bool true if the reward is expired (end <= now)

 Node operators are slashed the minimum of either the
 amount of rewards they have earned or the amount

 over the slashable duration.

documentation.text:
@notice Helper function when staker exits the pool
 @param staker The staker address
@dev Having a private function for the modifer saves on the contract size

@dev Reverts if the staking pool is inactive (not open for staking or
 expired)
@dev Reverts if the staking pool is active (open for staking)
@dev Reverts if not sent from the LINK token

acceptMigrationTarget().notice: This function allows the contract owner to accept a proposed migration target address after a waiting period.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

addOperators(address[]).notice: Adds one or more operators to a list of operators

addReward(uint256).notice: This function can be called to add rewards to the pool

canAlert(address).notice: This function checks to see whether the alerter may raise an alert to claim rewards

changeRewardRate(uint256).notice: This function can be called to change the reward rate for the pool. This change only affects future rewards, i.e. rewards earned at a previous rate are unaffected.

conclude().notice: Closes the pool, unreserving future staker rewards, expires the reward and releases unreserved rewards

getDelegatesCount().notice: Delegates count increases after an operator is added to the list of operators and stakes the minimum required amount.

getMigrationTarget().notice: This function returns the migration target contract address

getTotalDelegatedAmount().notice: Total delegated amount is calculated by dividing the total community staker staked amount by the delegation rate, i.e. totalDelegatedAmount = pool.totalCommunityStakedAmount / delegationRateDenominator

hasAccess(address,bytes32[]).notice: Validates if a community staker has access to the private staking pool

isActive().notice: The staking pool starts closed and only allows stakers to stake once it's opened

isOperator(address).notice: Returns true if an address is an operator

isPaused().notice: This function returns the pause state

migrate(bytes).notice: This function allows stakers to migrate funds to a new staking pool.

onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Called when LINK is sent to the contract via `transferAndCall`

proposeMigrationTarget(address).notice: This function allows the contract owner to set a proposed migration target address. If the migration target is valid it renounces the previously accepted migration target (if any).

raiseAlert().notice: This function creates an alert for a stalled feed

removeOperators(address[]).notice: Removes one or more operators from a list of operators. When an operator is removed, we store their principal in a separate mapping to prevent immediate withdrawals. This is so that the removed operator can only unstake at the same time as every other staker.

setFeedOperators(address[]).notice: Allows the contract owner to set the list of on-feed operator addresses who are subject to slashing

setMerkleRoot(bytes32).notice: This function is called to update the staking allowlist in a private staking pool

start(uint256,uint256).notice: Transfers LINK tokens and initializes the reward

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

unstake().notice: This function allows stakers to exit the pool after it has been concluded. It returns the principal as well as base and delegation rewards.

withdrawRemovedStake().notice: This function allows removed operators to withdraw their original principal. Operators can only withdraw after the pool is closed, like every other staker.

withdrawUnusedReward().notice: This function can be called to withdraw unused reward amount from the staking pool. It can be called before the pool is initialized, after the pool is concluded or when the reward expires.

addOperators(address[]).details: Required conditions for adding operators: - Operators can only be added to the pool if they have no prior stake. - Operators can only be readded to the pool if they have no removed stake. - Operators cannot be added to the pool after staking ends (either through conclusion or through reward expiry).

params.operators: A list of operator addresses to add

addReward(uint256).details: Should only be callable by the owner

params.amount: The amount of rewards to add to the pool

changeRewardRate(uint256).details: Should only be callable by the owner. The rate can be increased or decreased. The new rate cannot be 0.

emergencyPause().details: Sets the pause flag to true

emergencyUnpause().details: Sets the pause flag to false

getAvailableReward().details: This reflects how many rewards were made available over the lifetime of the staking pool. This is not updated when the rewards are unstaked or migrated by the stakers. This means that the contract balance will dip below available amount when the reward expires and users start moving their rewards.

getTotalRemovedAmount().details: Used to make sure that contract's balance is correct. total staked amount + total removed amount + available rewards = current balance

params.proof: Merkle proof for the community staker's allowlist

params.amount: Amount of LINK sent (specified in wei)
params.data: Optional payload containing a Staking Allowlist Merkle proof

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.migrationTarget: Contract address to migrate stakes to.

removeOperators(address[]).details: Should only be callable by the owner when the pool is open. When an operator is removed they can stake as a community staker. We allow that because the alternative (checking for removed stake before staking) is going to unnecessarily increase gas costs in 99.99% of the cases.

params.operators: A list of operator addresses to remove

setFeedOperators(address[]).details: Existing feed operators are cleared before setting the new operators.

params.operators: New list of on-feed operator staker addresses

setMerkleRoot(bytes32).details: Only callable by the contract owner

params.newMerkleRoot: Merkle Tree root, used to prove access for community stakers will be required at start but can be removed at any time by the owner when staking access will be granted to the public.

params.maxCommunityStakeAmount: The max amount of LINK a community staker can stake
params.maxOperatorStakeAmount: The max amount of LINK a Node Op can stake
params.maxPoolSize: The max amount of staked LINK allowed in the pool

params.initialRewardRate: The amount of LINK earned per second for each LINK staked.

withdrawUnusedReward().details: Should only be callable by the owner when the pool is closed

@notice Closes the pool, unreserving future staker rewards, expires the
 reward and releases unreserved rewards

@notice This function pauses staking
 @dev Sets the pause flag to true

@notice This function unpauses staking
 @dev Sets the pause flag to false

addOperators(address[]).notice: Adds one or more operators to a list of operators

addReward(uint256).notice: This function can be called to add rewards to the pool

changeRewardRate(uint256).notice: This function can be called to change the reward rate for the pool. This change only affects future rewards, i.e. rewards earned at a previous rate are unaffected.

conclude().notice: Closes the pool, unreserving future staker rewards, expires the reward and releases unreserved rewards

removeOperators(address[]).notice: Removes one or more operators from a list of operators. When an operator is removed, we store their principal in a separate mapping to prevent immediate withdrawals. This is so that the removed operator can only unstake at the same time as every other staker.

setFeedOperators(address[]).notice: Allows the contract owner to set the list of on-feed operator addresses who are subject to slashing

start(uint256,uint256).notice: Transfers LINK tokens and initializes the reward

withdrawUnusedReward().notice: This function can be called to withdraw unused reward amount from the staking pool. It can be called before the pool is initialized, after the pool is concluded or when the reward expires.

userdoc.notice: Owner functions restricted to the setup and maintenance of the staking contract by the owner.

addOperators(address[]).details: Should only callable by the Owner

params.operators: A list of operator addresses to add

addReward(uint256).details: Should only be callable by the owner

params.amount: The amount of rewards to add to the pool

changeRewardRate(uint256).details: Should only be callable by the owner. The rate can be increased or decreased. The new rate cannot be 0.

emergencyPause().details: Sets the pause flag to true

emergencyUnpause().details: Sets the pause flag to false

removeOperators(address[]).details: Should only be callable by the owner when the pool is open. When an operator is removed they can stake as a community staker. We allow that because the alternative (checking for removed stake before staking) is going to unnecessarily increase gas costs in 99.99% of the cases.

params.operators: A list of operator addresses to remove

setFeedOperators(address[]).details: Existing feed operators are cleared before setting the new operators.

params.operators: New list of on-feed operator staker addresses

params.maxCommunityStakeAmount: The max amount of LINK a community staker can stake
params.maxOperatorStakeAmount: The max amount of LINK a Node Op can stake
params.maxPoolSize: The max amount of staked LINK allowed in the pool

params.initialRewardRate: The amount of LINK earned per second for each LINK staked.

withdrawUnusedReward().details: Should only be callable by the owner when the pool is closed

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

documentation.text:
@notice This is a sample migration target contract.
 @dev The Staking v1 contract will need to implement something similar.

onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).notice: LINK transfer callback function called when transferAndCall is called with this contract as a target.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: This function allows the calling contract to check if the contract deployed at this address is a valid LINKTokenReceiver.  A contract is a valid LINKTokenReceiver if it implements the onTokenTransfer function.

userdoc.notice: This is a sample migration target contract.

params.data: Bytes data received, represents migration path

params.interfaceID: The ID of the interface to check against

devdoc.details: The Staking v1 contract will need to implement something similar.

nodes.name: transferAndCall

transferAndCall(address,uint256,bytes).details: transfer token to a contract address with additional data if the recipient is a contact.

params._data: The extra data to be passed to the receiving contract.

nodes.name: transferAndCall
transfer
approve
transferFrom

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params._owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params._spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

allowance(address,address).return: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender.

params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params._value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params._owner: The address to query the the balance of.

balanceOf(address).return: An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

transfer(address,uint256).details: transfer token to a specified address.

transferAndCall(address,uint256,bytes).details: transfer token to a specified address with additional data if the recipient is a contract.

params._data: The extra data to be passed to the receiving contract.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfer tokens from one address to another

params._from: address The address which you want to send tokens from
params._to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred
